visualization_prompt: Generate a Highcharts map chart showing US county-level unemployment rate distributions using a color gradient scale. Include state borders and interactive tooltips with state abbreviations.
visualization_explanation: The dataset combines geographical polygon data (county boundaries) with numerical unemployment rates. TopoJSON structure provides map topology while numerical values use ratio-scale measurements (0-25% range). External data sources from Highcharts ensure topological accuracy and statistical validity of economic indicators. The color gradient maintains numerical consistency with stops at critical unemployment thresholds (5% increments). The choropleth map maximizes data-ink ratio per Tufte by removing non-essential chart elements while preserving geographic context. Cairo's principles guide the sequential color scheme that matches human perception of ordered quantitative data. State borders (white lines) create gestalt grouping without competing with primary data encoding. Tooltips follow Bertin's principle of effective information retrieval by surfacing both nominal (state abbreviations) and quantitative (% values) data on demand.
